Exaggerate: The claim that the victims of the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting are alive exaggerates the situation and contradicts the fact that the shooting did happen and resulted in the deaths of 26 people.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School did occur and resulted in the deaths of 20 children and 6 adults.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks any evidence or support to substantiate the assertion that the victims are alive.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the shooting never happened and that the victims are crisis actors, which is a problematic assumption without any factual basis.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim is part of a conspiracy theory that suggests the shooting was a hoax, ignoring the alternative explanation that the shooting did occur and resulted in tragic loss of life.
